other_tests.findings: There is a small hyperechoic lesion in the left lobe of the liver measuring 9 mm in diameter, consistent in appearance with a hemangioma. The liver is otherwise homogeneous and normal in appearance. Doppler assessment of the main portal vein shows patency and hepatopetal flow. There is no ascites. The gallbladder demonstrates gallstones and is somewhat distended, but no other specific signs of disease are seen.
